title: Abbey Clancy’s lookalike daughter Sophia, eight, lands first modelling job
text:

Abbey Clancy’ s daughter is already following in her mum’s fashionable footsteps by modelling a new line of clothes.

Sophia Crouch, eight, who's dad is footballer Peter Crouch, posed alongside 33-year-old Abbey, in a stunning shoot for Next’s Lipsy range.

Abbey wore the adult collection while Sofia modelled Lipsy's kids clothes.

The pair were seen holding hands in sweet snaps taken inside a stunning stately home.

One of the shots shows mum and daughter wearing very similar black dresses, while another features them in almost matching feathered frocks.

Abbey and Peter are also parents to Liberty, four, Johnny, 20 months, and baby Jack, who was born in June.

(Image: Lipsy / PR Handout)

(Image: Lipsy / PR Handout)

The Liverpool-born beauty shot to fame in 2006 when she competed on the second series of Britain's next Top Model.

She finished second, and went on to carve out a successful career in the modelling industry.

Abbey looks incredible after going back to work following the birth of her third child over the summer.

(Image: Lipsy)

(Image: Lipsy)

The pair announced the news in June, joking they'd named their little boy "Divock Samrat".

In a post on social media, Peter wrote: "Our boy is beautiful the name is still to be clarified unfortunately Abs not going for Divock Samrat."

The footballer later explained the nickname had stuck for several weeks before they eventually confirmed he had been called Jonny.

Abbey later admitted she was struggling to juggle work with being a full-time mum of three.

(Image: Lipsy / PR Handout)

(Image: Lipsy / PR Handout)

The model told OK! magazine : "When I’m at home and the kids are driving me crazy, I want to go to work and be on my own for an hour. I love having a busy house, though, it just feels really natural to me.”

She also opened up on finding balance, as she said: "You’ve got the school run, you’ve got homework, you’ve got after-school clubs, play dates and toddler groups. It’s finding that balance and not feeling guilty about leaving them to have an hour to yourself.

"It’s hard as a mum and you’ve just got to listen to your body, go with whatever feels right to you and follow your heart."

(Image: Lipsy / PR Handout)
